alert.note: Alert for Bland; Giles (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 11:53AM EDT until May 29 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Bland and Giles. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding along Wolf Creek, as well as along other creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations feeding into Wolf Creek, is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1148 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated light to occasionally moderate rainfall approaching the noon hour. However, river gages indicated that all rivers and streams continue to rise quickly, and flooding is expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Narrows, Rocky Gap and Chapel. - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
